revised_title: Optimizing Windowless Vapour Containment Systems for Absorption Spectroscopy
tldr: The article discusses the dynamics of windowless vapour containment systems for absorption spectroscopy, focusing on the relations between mass loss-rates and path number-density integrals for various geometries. The authors develop a simple relation between the flow regime required to observe optical absorption and the ratio of absorption to gas collisional cross sections. They propose a furnace design that optimizes optical absorption depth with respect to mass loss rate over a wide range of pressures, providing order-of-magnitude improvements over simple orifice impedances.
